reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Enhancing Logistics Capabilities of the SS Militar. Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services - Other U.S. Government Agency Contract Services (A, B, C) (ITA). Integral Humanitarian Mine Action in Colombia 201

description.narrative: This award strives to help foreign partners professionalize their military forces through educational programs and technical support, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. More specifically, this includes Gus Fahey, COR & Kelley Kershner, CS[Covers services supplied by other U.S. Government agencies not otherwise classified.]. Supply/Transp/Procurement. TRAFFICKING IN PERSONS[Covers services supplied by other U.S. Government agencies not otherwise classified.]. Information has been redacted in accordance with the two principled exceptions defined in the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act (FATAA) of 2016: the health and security of implementing partners, and the national interest of the United States.. SUPPLY/TRANSP/PROCUREMENT Gus Fahey, COR & Kelley Kershner, CS[Covers services supplied by other U.S. Government agencies not otherwise classified.]. INM-EOP[Covers services supplied by other U.S. Government agencies not otherwise classified.]. Covers services supplied by other U.S. Government agencies not otherwise classified..

Through educational programs and technical support, help foreign partners professionalize their military forces, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. In addition, activities assist foreign partners so that their military forces reliably demonstrate consistent support for adherence to norms of human rights; support the concept of civilian executive authority/control of the military; and have the capacity for institutional and security sector reform.
